meta.title: Benchmarks | Hologram
meta.description: Sub-microsecond quantum circuit execution. Canonicalization in 0.8-2.5μs, full execution in 3-13μs. See the numbers.

hero.title: Executed in
hero.description: These aren't projections or simulations—they're actual benchmarks from real hardware. While you read this sentence, Hologram could execute millions of quantum circuits. Geometric canonicalization delivers execution speeds that challenge what you thought possible.

gauges.title: Performance
gauges.description: Real-time visualization of execution speed across all benchmarks.

comparisons.title: Speed in
comparisons.description: Microseconds are abstract. Here's what they mean.

relatable.label: Faster Than Thought
relatable.description: Human neural processing takes ~13ms. Hologram executes in ~13μs.

relatable.label: Faster Than Blinking
relatable.description: One blink (300ms) = time for 100,000 circuit executions.

relatable.label: Per Heartbeat
relatable.description: Circuits executed in a single 50ms heartbeat interval.

relatable.label: Light Distance
relatable.description: How far light travels during one execution at peak speed.

technical.title: Technical Comparison
technical.description: How Hologram stacks up against common computing operations.

charts.title: The Numbers
charts.description: All 16 benchmarks visualized. Hover for confidence intervals.

details.title: Benchmark
details.description: Click any benchmark for detailed statistics including confidence intervals.

cta.title: See For Yourself
cta.description: Clone the repo. Run the benchmarks. Verify the numbers. The speed is real.
